Author: Moderator
Message: Welcome FelixKitty

Author: FelixKitty
Message: Test

Author: Moderator
Message: Thank you for participating in this study.

Author: Moderator
Message: In the next posts, I'll be going over the rules of the "game" you're about to play.

Author: Moderator
Message: Once I'll be done, I'll ask you if you've understood the rules, and if you haven't I'll explain them in different words.

Author: Moderator
Message: You're about to talk to Andrew. Andrew is a fictive character that has been completely created for the purpose of this study.

Author: Moderator
Message: You'll be talking to him twice.

Author: Moderator
Message: The only difference between the two conversations you'll have with him, is that in one of them Andrew will be played by a real human.

Author: Moderator
Message: In the other, it will be played by an Artificial Intelligence we are developing.

Author: Moderator
Message: We will call the Human and the Artificial Intelligence the Actors.

Author: Moderator
Message: The order in which you'll be talking to each Actor is random.

Author: Moderator
Message: You will not be talking twice with the same Actor.

Author: Moderator
Message: Both the Artificial Intelligence and the Human will try to portray the same Andrew in the most convincing way they can.

Author: Moderator
Message: Your goal is simple. After talking to the two actors, you'll have to guess which one was the Artificial Intelligence and which one was the Human.

Author: Moderator
Message: Whenever you have made your decision, you are able to stop the conversation.

Author: Moderator
Message: Each conversation will last for 15 minutes maximum if you do not decide to stop it before.

Author: Moderator
Message: Please, keep your posts to text only (No smileys, no links... etc)

Author: Moderator
Message: Do not type more than one post per answer.

Author: Moderator
Message: Do you understand the rules and what you have to do?

Author: FelixKitty
Message: YEs

Author: Moderator
Message: Good. Andrew will start the conversation. The 15 minutes will start after your answer. Are you ready?

Author: FelixKitty
Message: Yes

Author: Andrew
Message: Hello!

Author: FelixKitty
Message: Hello there!

Author: Andrew
Message: How are you doing?

Author: FelixKitty
Message: I'm doing alright, how about yourself?

Author: Andrew
Message: I'm doing quite alright! What are you up to?

Author: FelixKitty
Message: Nothing much right now, myself. What about you?

Author: Andrew
Message: Ah alright. I'm playing a little bit of Minecraft.

Author: FelixKitty
Message: Oh nice! Up to anything neat with it?

Author: Andrew
Message: I've been walking around in circle for a bit now. I'm not sure yet.

Author: FelixKitty
Message: Trying to decide what to build?

Author: Andrew
Message: Do you play it too? Yeah pretty much.

Author: FelixKitty
Message: I do, though not as much as I used to. I haven't had the motivation to work on my projects

Author: Andrew
Message: What kind of projects?

Author: FelixKitty
Message: One's a starship, another is a light rail network, and the third one is a custom recreation of a facility from a book I read in middle school

Author: Andrew
Message: How long have you been working on those? That is pretty cool actually.

Author: FelixKitty
Message: The first two, on and off since 2013. The other one, I started late last year and haven't come very far with it

Author: Andrew
Message: That must be a very big airship. That's a lot of work then!

Author: FelixKitty
Message: Yup! And it's all been by hand, which is a huge factor of the time to build these projects.

Author: Andrew
Message: Oh yeah. There are ways to make it a lot easier. You've never been tempted to?

Author: FelixKitty
Message: I've been tempted, but I view it as sort of cheating the effort really. Plus, it's easier if I have to go back and redesign something.

Author: Andrew
Message: You don't play survival at all? And yeah fair enough.

Author: FelixKitty
Message: I play it here and there, but it's vanilla Minecraft when I do

Author: Andrew
Message: Do you play on a server at all? It can be quite boring.

Author: FelixKitty
Message: Not usually. Most of the time it's by myself.

Author: Andrew
Message: That might be why you have a lack of motivation.

Author: FelixKitty
Message: Maybe, but part of it is just not knowing where to go from where I'm at now

Author: Andrew
Message: Do you play anything else? Yeah I see.

Author: FelixKitty
Message: Not too many other games really. I'm not much of a gamer.

Author: Andrew
Message: What do you like to be doing?

Author: FelixKitty
Message: Mostly chatting online, or building stuff in Lego Digital Designer.

Author: Andrew
Message: What is that? I've never heard of it.

Author: Moderator
Message: Time is up!

Author: Moderator
Message: Which actor do you think you've been talking to (This is not your final answer)

Author: FelixKitty
Message: The Artificial Intelligence

Author: Moderator
Message: Alright. We'll start the next conversation. Andrew will begin and then you'll have 15 minutes after your answer. Are you ready?

Author: FelixKitty
Message: Yes

Author: Andrew
Message: Hello!

Author: FelixKitty
Message: Hiya!

Author: Andrew
Message: How are you doing?

Author: FelixKitty
Message: I'm alright, how about yourself?

Author: Andrew
Message: I'm doing quite alright. What are you up to?

Author: FelixKitty
Message: Nothing too much really. What about you?

Author: Andrew
Message: I'm not doing much. I might just play a bit of Minecraft.

Author: FelixKitty
Message: Oh? Anything in particular you might do in it?

Author: Andrew
Message: I'm not entirely sure yet actually. But I'm open for ideas!

Author: FelixKitty
Message: Well, are you playing Survival? Or creative?

Author: Andrew
Message: I play a bit of both. I'm on a server actually most of the time.

Author: FelixKitty
Message: Oh nice. What sort of server?

Author: Andrew
Message: It's basically a medieval themed server, and a bit of a RPG.

Author: FelixKitty
Message: Oh, that's cool!

Author: Andrew
Message: Yeah, it also tries to bring some creative aspect within the difficulty of survival.

Author: FelixKitty
Message: Nice! I mostly stick to single player, myself

Author: Andrew
Message: I find it more fun playing with others. It gets old very fast if I play on my own.

Author: FelixKitty
Message: Fair enough. It works for me since I'm usually the only one with the schematics for what I'm building in my head

Author: Andrew
Message: Yeah, it's hard working with other people. It helps being on a call at the same time.

Author: FelixKitty
Message: Yeah, that's true. Makes it easier to coordinate

Author: Andrew
Message: What kind of things do you like to build? Medieval buildings too?

Author: FelixKitty
Message: Nah, mostly modern/futuristic stuff myself.

Author: Andrew
Message: Oh I see. It can be quite cool as well, and less common.

Author: FelixKitty
Message: Yup. Especially with mods to make things a bit easier to build

Author: Andrew
Message: Which mods do you use? I used to like one that made you able to build ships.

Author: FelixKitty
Message: Mostly mods to increase the capabilities of Redstone, and for aesthetic stuff. ProjectRed for example

Author: Andrew
Message: I don't think I've heard of it actually.

Author: FelixKitty
Message: It's a good one. It gives you better components to work with, such as wire and stuff, and also lets you take a giant redstone circuit and put it into one plate.

Author: Andrew
Message: Oh yeah it's sounds pretty cool actually! I should try it.

Author: Moderator
Message: Time is up!

Author: Moderator
Message: Which actor do you think you've been talking to in the FIRST conversation?

Author: FelixKitty
Message: The Artificial Intelligence

Author: Moderator
Message: On a scale from 1 (not sure at all) to 7 (certain), how confident are you of your answer?

Author: Moderator
Message: Alright thank you for your participation! If you've given your e-mail, we'll send you some information about the results of this study in the coming months.

Author: Moderator
Message: If you have any comments you'd like to share, feel free to do so now. Otherwise, you can now close this window.

Author: FelixKitty
Message: THe second Andrew felt more fluid, the conversation more human. The first one felt a bit choppy, and I couldn't see an actual human player just aimlessly going in circles in Minecraft.

Author: Andrew
Message: Alright! Thank you!
